case.name: Unsworth v Tristar Steering and Suspension Australia Limited [2007] FCA 1082 (20 July 2007)

citation.tocase: Sparnon v Apand Pty Ltd (1996) 68 FCR 322
citation.text: Counsel for the respondent has referred me to the decision of Branson J in Sparnon v Apand Pty Ltd (1996) 68 FCR 322 to support the proposition that the onus lies upon the applicant to establish the required dominant purpose as an objective fact although based upon the evidence which is given. Counsel for the respondent also referred to the decision of the New South Wales Court of Appeal in Westpac Banking Corporation v 789Ten Pty Ltd (2005) 55 ACSR 519; [2005] NSWCA 321 , particularly per Tobias JA at [57] [58].

citation.tocase: Westpac Banking Corporation v 789Ten Pty Limited (2005) 55 ACSR 519; [2005] NSWCA 321
citation.text: Counsel for the respondent has referred me to the decision of Branson J in Sparnon v Apand Pty Ltd (1996) 68 FCR 322 to support the proposition that the onus lies upon the applicant to establish the required dominant purpose as an objective fact although based upon the evidence which is given. Counsel for the respondent also referred to the decision of the New South Wales Court of Appeal in Westpac Banking Corporation v 789Ten Pty Ltd (2005) 55 ACSR 519; [2005] NSWCA 321 , particularly per Tobias JA at [57] [58].
